Detailed Description

This abstract class represents the concept of objective functional for the multilayer perceptron. Any derived class must implement the calculateEvaluation(void) method.

See also:
MultilayerPerceptron.

Definition at line 30 of file ObjectiveFunctional.h.

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum Flood::ObjectiveFunctional::NumericalEpsilonMethod

Enumeration of available methods for obtaining a numerical value of epsilon to be used in numerical differentiation.

Enumerator:
Absolute 
Relative

enum Flood::ObjectiveFunctional::NumericalDifferentiationMethod

Enumeration of available methods for calculating any derivative of the objective function numerically.

Enumerator:
ForwardDifferences 
CentralDifferences

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Flood::ObjectiveFunctional::ObjectiveFunctional ( MultilayerPerceptron *  newMultilayerPerceptron  ) 

General constructor. It creates an objective functional object associated to a multilayer perceptron object. It also initializes all the rest of class members to their default values:

  • Numerical epsilon method: Relative.
  • Numerical differentiation method: Central differences.
  • Number of evaluations = 0.
  • Numerical epsilon: 1.0e-6.
  • Display: true.

Parameters:
newMultilayerPerceptron Pointer to a multilayer perceptron object.

Definition at line 40 of file ObjectiveFunctional.cpp.

References CentralDifferences, display, multilayerPerceptron, numberOfEvaluations, numericalDifferentiationMethod, numericalEpsilon, numericalEpsilonMethod, and Relative.

Flood::ObjectiveFunctional::ObjectiveFunctional ( void   ) 

General constructor. It creates an objective functional object not associated to any multilayer perceptron object. It also initializes all the rest of class members to their default values:

  • Numerical epsilon method: Relative.
  • Numerical differentiation method: Central differences.
  • Number of evaluations = 0.
  • Numerical epsilon: 1.0e-6.
  • Display: true.

double Flood::ObjectiveFunctional::calculatePotentialEvaluation ( Vector< double >  potentialFreeParameters  ) 

This method returns which would be the objective evaluation of a multilayer perceptron for an hypothetical vector of free parameters. It does not set that vector of free parameters to the multilayer perceptron.

Parameters:
potentialFreeParameters Vector of a potential free parameters for the multilayer perceptron associated to the objective functional.
See also:
calculateEvaluation(void).

Vector< double > Flood::ObjectiveFunctional::calculateGradient ( void   )  [virtual]

This method returns the objective function gradient vector for a multilayer perceptron.

See also:
calculateEvaluation(void).
This method returns the default objective function gradient vector, which is computed using numerical differentiation.

See also:

Matrix< double > Flood::ObjectiveFunctional::calculateHessian ( void   )  [virtual]

This method returns the objective function Hessian matrix for a multilayer perceptron. Please, do not use this method. It is not yet implemented!

This method returns the default objective function Hessian matrix, which is computed using numerical differentiation.

See also:
NumericalEpsilonMethod.

NumericalDifferentiationMethod.

Reimplemented in Flood::DeJongFunction, Flood::EasomFunction, and Flood::RastriginFunction.

Matrix< double > Flood::ObjectiveFunctional::calculateInverseHessian ( void   )  [virtual]

This method returns inverse matrix of the Hessian. It first computes the Hessian matrix and then computes its inverse.

Reimplemented in Flood::DeJongFunction, Flood::EasomFunction, and Flood::RastriginFunction.

Matrix< double > Flood::ObjectiveFunctional::calculateDFPInverseHessianApproximation ( Vector< double >  oldFreeParameters,
Vector< double >  oldGradient,
Matrix< double >  oldInverseHessian,
Vector< double >  freeParameters,
Vector< double >  gradient 
)

This method returns an approximation of the inverse Hessian matrix according to the Davidon-Fletcher-Powel (DFP) algorithm.

Parameters:
oldFreeParameters A previous set of free parameters.
oldGradient The gradient of the objective function for that previous set of free parameters.
oldInverseHessian The Hessian of the objective function for that previous set of free parameters.
freeParameters Actual set of free parameters.
gradient The gradient of the objective function for the actual set of free parameters.

Vector< double >  oldGradient,
Matrix< double >  oldInverseHessian,
Vector< double >  freeParameters,

)

This method returns an approximation of the inverse Hessian matrix according to the Broyden-Fletcher-Goldfarb-Shanno (BGFS) algorithm.
